messages.subject: Re: learning to let go/deschooling...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/5/2003 11:46:08 AM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: Are we invited too? **************** Sure...Maybe
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/5/2003 11:46:08 AM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
Are we invited too?
****************
Sure...Maybe we need to have a party...or a conference...hmm...how about a
weekend long conference near Boston...say...in Peabody...

Yeah, come visit...but I have a small house!
Kathryn

messages.subject: Re: learning to let go/deschooling...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/4/2003 8:53:10 AM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: ANYWAY..I know that I m rambling..I just wanted to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/4/2003 8:53:10 AM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
ANYWAY..I know that I'm rambling..I just wanted to share my thoughts with
others who understand. Sometimes I feel rather lonely because I don't know anyone
else who unschools in my area.
************************
Beth, consider this an invitation. Gather the kids in the car soon, drive a
couple hours north, and come to Salem for a couple days. We'll kick Julian out
of his room and you can stay here. We'll do some fun things and we can talk
about unshooling and you and your kids can meet Julian and see how unschooled
kids turn out.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
